meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Online Store Can Sell Data The Federal Trade Commission reached a settlement to permit Toysmart.com to sell its customer database as part of its bankruptcy proceedings, but it put strict restrictions on the sale. PAGE C1

Online Store Can Sell Data The Federal Trade Commission reached a settlement to permit Toysmart.com to sell its customer database as part of its bankruptcy proceedings, but it put strict restrictions on the sale. PAGE C1

Iran's Campus Evolution Women in Iran are seeking college educations in historically high numbers as part of a quiet revolution that has wide-ranging social implications. They now make up almost 60 percent of all entrants. PAGE A3
Guilty Plea in Caviar Case One of the nation's largest caviar importers pleaded guilty to smuggling charges in a case that ranged from the Caspian Sea to the Mississippi River. PAGE A8
Virus Spraying Is Hampered Mayor Giuliani criticized state and federal environmental officials for blocking New York from spraying in wetlands to kill mosquitoes carrying the West Nile virus. PAGE B1
On Deck for Mets: Larkin The Mets and Reds have agreed to a deal that would bring shortstop Barry Larkin to New York. Larkin, however, must also agree. SPORTSSATURDAY, PAGE D1
